> Hello again,
> 
> this time I am trying to understand the=
 AList implementation. I have
three 
> questions:
> 
> 1. Is there any spec=
ial reason why you use a Hashtable instead of a
HashMap? 
> Do we need Hash=
table's internal synchronization?

No reason other than thats the way its a=
lways been.  The
st.ata.util.HashtableAlist was a contribution made early o=
n by Raymie
Stata.  It has some utility beyond Hashtable. I've not made a s=
urvey
to see if we actual exploit this utility.  Neither have I made a
surv=
ey to see if synchronization is needed (Off the top of my head,
I'd think i=
t not needed).

> 2. Is it necessary to throw NoSuchElementExceptions when =
a key is not 
> contained in the table? This usually makes an additional
"c=
ontainsKey" call 
> necessary (like in the logging classes). Could you perh=
aps add extra
getter 
> methods without this check?
> 

No problem.  Say wh=
at you want or send over a patch.

> 3. Why are these classes outside the o=
rg.archive package tree (in 
> "st.ata.util")?
> 
> 
See above.
